lines.text: Enter MISTRESS PAGE and ROBIN

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Nay, keep your way, little gallant; you were wont to be a follower, but now you are a leader. Whether had you rather lead mine eyes, or eye your master's heels?

lines.speaker: robin
lines.text: I had rather, forsooth, go before you like a man than follow him like a dwarf.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: O, you are a flattering boy: now I see you'll be a courtier.
Enter FORD

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Well met, Mistress Page. Whither go you?

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Truly, sir, to see your wife. Is she at home?

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Ay; and as idle as she may hang together, for want of company. I think, if your husbands were dead, you two would marry.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: Be sure of that,--two other husbands.

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Where had you this pretty weather-cock?

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: I cannot tell what the dickens his name is my husband had him of. What do you call your knight's name, sirrah?

lines.speaker: robin
lines.text: Sir John Falstaff.

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Sir John Falstaff!

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: He, he; I can never hit on's name. There is such a league between my good man and he! Is your wife at home indeed?

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Indeed she is.

lines.speaker: mistress page
lines.text: By your leave, sir: I am sick till I see her.
Exeunt MISTRESS PAGE and ROBIN

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Has Page any brains? hath he any eyes? hath he any thinking? Sure, they sleep; he hath no use of them. Why, this boy will carry a letter twenty mile, as easy as a cannon will shoot point-blank twelve score. He pieces out his wife's inclination; he gives her folly motion and advantage: and now she's going to my wife, and Falstaff's boy with her. A man may hear this shower sing in the wind. And Falstaff's boy with her! Good plots, they are laid; and our revolted wives share damnation together. Well; I will take him, then torture my wife, pluck the borrowed veil of modesty from the so seeming Mistress Page, divulge Page himself for a secure and wilful Actaeon; and to these violent proceedings all my neighbours shall cry aim. The clock gives me my cue, and my assurance bids me search: there I shall find Falstaff: I shall be rather praised for this than mocked; for it is as positive as the earth is firm that Falstaff is there: I will go.
Clock heard
Enter PAGE, SHALLOW, SLENDER, Host, SIR HUGH EVANS, DOCTOR CAIUS, and RUGBY

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Well met, Master Ford.

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: Trust me, a good knot: I have good cheer at home; and I pray you all go with me.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: I must excuse myself, Master Ford.

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: And so must I, sir: we have appointed to dine with Mistress Anne, and I would not break with her for more money than I'll speak of.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: We have lingered about a match between Anne Page and my cousin Slender, and this day we shall have our answer.

lines.speaker: slender
lines.text: I hope I have your good will, father Page.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: You have, Master Slender; I stand wholly for you: but my wife, master doctor, is for you altogether.

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Ay, be-gar; and de maid is love-a me: my nursh-a Quickly tell me so mush.

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: What say you to young Master Fenton? he capers, he dances, he has eyes of youth, he writes verses, he speaks holiday, he smells April and May: he will carry't, he will carry't; 'tis in his buttons; he will carry't.

lines.speaker: page
lines.text: Not by my consent, I promise you. The gentleman is of no having: he kept company with the wild prince and Poins; he is of too high a region; he knows too much. No, he shall not knit a knot in his fortunes with the finger of my substance: if he take her, let him take her simply; the wealth I have waits on my consent, and my consent goes not that way.

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: I beseech you heartily, some of you go home with me to dinner: besides your cheer, you shall have sport; I will show you a monster. Master doctor, you shall go; so shall you, Master Page; and you, Sir Hugh.

lines.speaker: shallow
lines.text: Well, fare you well: we shall have the freer wooing at Master Page's.
Exeunt SHALLOW, and SLENDER

lines.speaker: doctor caius
lines.text: Go home, John Rugby; I come anon.
Exit RUGBY

lines.speaker: host
lines.text: Farewell, my hearts: I will to my honest knight Falstaff, and drink canary with him.
Exit

lines.speaker: ford
lines.text: [Aside]  I think I shall drink in pipe wine first with him; I'll make him dance. Will you go, gentles?

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Have with you to see this monster.
Exeunt
